page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO WOORE
page.content: The civil parish of Woore also includes{Dorrington, Gravenhunger, {Pipe Gate and Bearstone.} Only a small neck of land keeps Woore as a part of Shropshire. In the administrative area of North Shropshire, Woore is virtually surrounded by Cheshire and Staffordshire. The centre of the village is around the crossroads of the{A51}and the{ {A525.} Within a radius of 100 metres are grocery shops, butchers' shops, a bakery, a garage, three public houses, a sub-post office, hardware shop, a church and a primary school. From the highest point in the village the{Wrekin}is easily visible to the south, while to the north one overlooks the whole{Cheshire Plain. { The population}is about one thousand and at the local election in 1985 there were 793 voters on the register.
